comments.body: Is it possible to run these on PRs that modify alembic or sqlalchemy files as well?
Yes, it's possible. Should we skip this check on PRs that **don't** affect alembic or sqlalchemy files (since it takes roughly 1 ~ 2 min.)?
Ah, I didn't realize this was set up to run on every PR since I didn't see it in the set of tests run on this PR. Am I missing something?
It's run on every PR now because it's executed in the python-large check.
Ah, got it - missed the header. Thanks Haru!

comments.body: Why do we need to install smalls here as well?

It's just the way the install-common-deps.sh helper script is written, we independently flag-on installation of small/large dependencies. In the future, maybe we should refactor the helper script so that you declaratively specify what job type you're running (small or large python tests, java tests, etc) and it installs the appropriate dependencies - this would make it easier to e.g. repro the steps of a github actions run on your local machine.

Yep makes sense!

comments.body:
Looks like this currently uses node 10.x (from github actions JS [build logs](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/pull/2724/checks?check_run_id=595900760)):

```
Run actions/setup-node@v1
  with:
    always-auth: false
    node-version: 10.x
```


Maybe we should pin to that version (i.e. add `node-version: 10.x` as in the [example here](https://github.com/actions/setup-node#usage))? Couldn't figure out how the nodejs action picks which version to install if none is specified (looking at [this code](https://github.com/actions/setup-node/blob/339aa41a8d72adcf661974ca2a947fa1e144530e/src/setup-node.ts#L12-L18), you'd expect it to not install nodejs at all if no `version` or `node-version` attribute is specified)
Done!

comments.body: Mostly modeled after `.travis.yml`, a couple oddities about github actions.
Had to re-export and re-activate the test environment, since these are set in `install-common-deps.sh` but Github Actions clears env variables between steps.

diffHunk:

        export GITHUB_WORKFLOW=1
        export PATH="$HOME/miniconda/bin:$PATH"
        source activate test-environment
        ./travis/run-small-python-tests.sh
